text: Psalm 32
Thanksgiving for Forgiveness of Sins
Of David. A maskil.\f + \fr Ps 32 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Happy \add is\add* he whose transgression is taken away,
whose sin is covered.
Happy \add is\add* a person to whom Yahweh does not impute iniquity
and in whose spirit there is not deceit.
When I kept silent, my bones were worn out
due to my groaning all the day.
For day and night your hand was heavy upon me.
My vigor was changed into \add the\add* dry heat of summer. \qs Selah\qs*
I made known my sin to you, and my iniquity I did not cover.
I said, “I will confess concerning my transgressions to Yahweh,”
and you took away the guilt of my sin. \qs Selah\qs*
Therefore let all \add the\add* faithful pray to you
at \add the\add* time \add for\add* finding \add you\add*.
Surely at \add the\add* flood of many waters they will not reach him.
You \add are\add* my hiding place;
from trouble you preserve me.
\add With\add* cries of deliverance you surround me. \qs Selah\qs*
I\f + \fr 32:8 \ft Yahweh is speaking in vv. \xt 8–9 \ft \f* will instruct you and teach you
in \add the\add* way that you should go.
I will advise \add you\add* \add with\add* my eye upon you.
Do not be like a horse \add or\add* like a mule, without understanding;
\add that needs\add* his tackle—bridle and rein—for restraint
\add or he would not\add* come near you.
Many are \add the\add* pains of the wicked,
but \add for\add* the one who trusts Yahweh
loyal love surrounds him.
Be glad in Yahweh and rejoice, \add you\add* righteous,
and shout for joy, all \add you\add* upright of heart.
